subject: p13352405
History: Followup of the patient with right VATS for empyema due to complicated pneumonia.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Heart size and mediastinum are stable. Tortuous aorta is re-demonstrated. Right pleural effusion appears to be unchanged/minimally smaller since the prior study, again most likely loculated posteriorly and laterally. Aeration of the right lower lung has minimally improved. Left lung is essentially clear. Multiple rib fractures are re-demonstrated bilaterally.
